website_summaries.verdict: This rugged pad cushions against falls, molds well to uneven ground and features hidden snack pockets. Be forewarned, though, it's a bit heavy.
pros: Fill system enables pad to both lay flat and fold easily
Molds well to rocks and uneven ground
cons: A bit large and heavy to carry to your climbing location
Be sure to follow directions for breaking in

customer_reviews.title: Stitching is coming undone
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I bought this to start bouldering a bit. Mostly in joshua tree, we’ve had it a while but only used it on 4-5 trips so far, it’s bulky but I don’t mind the size, it molds to the ground nicely. The one big con we are having with it is that the stitching is coming undone and it keep leaking the foam. A real pain in the ass when try to leave no trace. Wife has stitched up 2 separate holes the developed. Not sure what’s up, otherwise it’s seems like a good pad. Added a pic, you can see a new hole forming and an old hole my wife is stitching.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Eh, consider something else. HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: This pad caught my eye for the price I found it. Unfortunatly, it's pretty heavy comparing to the metolious and mad rock pads. Also, because of how the pad folds it feels a little awkward on my back like its lop sidded and sits uneven. I like how thick it is and mold able to the ground but considering the weight I would recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pad for shorter approaches and can be used on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pad for shorter approaches and can be used on its own for low falls or as the perfect supplement to other pads to cover up rocks by your landing. This pad is my group's go to, it's kinda heavy but I'm a bigger guy so I don't mind too much and I can put all my stuff inside very easily. We use it a lot to throw over rocks on the sides of landings because it can curve over them where a normal pad would be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Must have crash pad
customer_reviews.text: You'll rarely find ground that's even next to some sweet routes. That's where this guy comes along. It'll contour around rocks, roots or whatever, but it'll still provide a soft yet firm fall. While on the heavy side of pads it's versatility makes up for it. The straps when done right doesn't make it as heavy. Plus you can store stuff between the padding. All my friends now own one
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth N.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this buy - it has performed admirably on ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever crash pad purchase, after doing extensive research. That said, I'm very happy with this buy - it has performed admirably on several occasions, and is easy to pack up & transport.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Silva

customer_reviews.title: Perfect crash mat!
customer_reviews.text: The crash mat was perfect because it wasn't super small or super big, just the right size to be able to comfortable hike out to your favorite bouldering spot. Offers a fair amount of safe space when bouldering, I really like how its not sectional making it easier to lay over odd shaped rocks or tree roots. Really durable so far, haven't had any issues with rips or tearing and seems to really hold up to a beating. Overall great product and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Block

customer_reviews.title: Nice big crash pad
customer_reviews.text: Nice big crash pad. Versatile and very handy for uneven landings that need a conforming pad. I like the use of recycled foam! The biggest downside is that this thing weighs a ton. If you're on a long approach, you're better off leaving this one behind and carrying all 4 of your buddy's pads for them.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Miller Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Feels great to land on
customer_reviews.text: Feels great to land on. If you're camping it also acts as a portable couch for two when folded in half. Another feature I didn't even realize it had until I bought it is that it has a sort of bottom when folded. This means you can throw all your other gear inside it when hiking to the rocks. This feature alone is worth the 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Slagathor

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing pad
customer_reviews.text: Great climbing pad! The pad conforms well to uneven landings and serves it's purpose well. Lots of storage space inside the pad when closed up. Seems very well-made and durable. Overall a great pad and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: It's just me

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent crash pad but the weight makes it impractical to carry any long distances. I own the regular mad rocks pad as well and there is a very noticeable difference in comfort and weight
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: I do wish the straps were more comfortable. I carry a lot of stuff with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid crash pad. Been using it a lot when I go to joshua tree as a seat, sleeping pad, and oc course crash pad. I do wish the straps were more comfortable. I carry a lot of stuff with it and it's a bit tough to cary with the straps they have. I do love how big it is. Over all this os probabably the best crash pad on this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving it!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing you can get this with free shipping!! Great crash pad!!! Stays flat on the most uneven ground. I wanted safety > pad weight. * get a different crash pad if your worried about carrying the weight. It's heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Shane H

customer_reviews.title: Best crash pad in the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable and well built crash pad you can buy! I own 3 crash pads and this is my favorite one by far. I can carry a lot of gear inside this crash pad, it has an integrated tarp that extends and protects the back and waist straps from the dirt when you put it on the floor, which is a plus because if there's mud in the ground and your pad doesn't have this, you will get your shirt all dirty. Every climber I know loves this crash pad and are always asking me if they can borrow it for bouldering, so yes, buy it and you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Oneill Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Good pad, but cannot wash in washing machine
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the pad is small plastic particles, so you can't unzip the cover and throw it in the washing machine without having thousands of tiny pieces of plastic everywhere. Good pad, but I wish it was designed to be more easily washable.
customer_reviews.author: Madmartigan

customer_reviews.title: Best for value and portability
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best mats for the value. 👌🏻 It is longer than most one man pads and it is also very comfortable to carry in backpack form. If you do get this don’t fold it in half, roll it for transport.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I love this pad
customer_reviews.text: I love this pad. Just took a fall from ~5ft flat on my back on a pretty rocky surface, felt alot better than I was expecting. It's not that heavy to me, but I'm usually packing ropes and gear up a mountain. I'll be grabbing a second one.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it's flexibility and works really well outdoors in those ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed crashpad. Love it's flexibility and works really well outdoors in those areas where the ground isn't quite even or you get some odd poking rock that won't let your other crashpads sit well. We use this in conjunction with other pads.
customer_reviews.author: N.G.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR FALLING. BUT HEAVY FOR HIKING
customer_reviews.text: Crash Pad is awesome.. .took it out for some climbs outdoors, me and my buddies had around 7 pads. And this one was definitely the most comfortable to fall in. Shapes to any kind of terrain and its durable. Only down side. is its heavy, you are in for a work out if you have to hike this thing up some trails. Id say it ways around 20 lbs. but after a long day of hiking it seems like 40lb, I personally can carry this pad and enjoy the haul, some people might not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pad, recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I love this crash pad! It's a little heavier than other lower end pads, but it's well worth the added weight and cost. The shoulder and waist straps are great, and you can carry all your gear inside. There are lots of great details, like the cover for your straps while you've got it on the ground to keep them clean/dry, all the handles, and the versitality of being able to put it over uneven surfaces. I always look forward to using it. Even better that it keeps waste out of landfills.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stephens

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The R3 makes an excellent crash pad and excels at protecting uneven landings. It covers are large area and all my landings have been comfortable thus far. The only reason I do not give it 5 stars is that it is bulky and heavy. Not unmanageable at all. The shoulder harness is much better than I have had on any other pad. Once you have the pad on your shoulders it feels like a much smaller and lighter pad. No hesitation in recommending this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this can be used on uneven terrain which was the main reason why I picked it out. The straps are pretty nice to carry it with. Longest hike I've had to was only about two miles though. It does what it's intended to do and I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Linsy

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than I expected but it works great. I got it for under my daughters bars
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I expected but it works great. I got it for under my daughters bars, but she uses it as a mat/spring board to launch onto the bars.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crash pad
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our first outdoor climbing adventure. With 3 young kids, we wanted to find something that would work well with uneven surfaces. This pad was perfect for us. It wasn't too stiff, and it was cushioned enough that my kids could fall and still be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lil beau

customer_reviews.title: Slipped, fell, landed, got up - repeat, safely
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to carry in with the backpack style straps.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Rose

customer_reviews.title: ... crash pad to my son and he is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this crash pad to my son and he is very happy with it. The individual baffles allow the pad to comfortably go over whatever is on the ground. He also liked the fact that he could wear it like a backpack and carry his other stuff inside the folded pad. It cleaned up easily too. The straps have protective covers on them when it is laid on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Worth the weight.
customer_reviews.text: I love this crash pad. It's pretty heavy but that should just give you a bit more of an exercise on your way to some boulders. I really like how it will bend over a rock and it seems to provide a lot padding.
customer_reviews.author: shane bird

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but useful
customer_reviews.text: It's painfully heavy, but useful for uneven surfaces where standard pads are a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a second crash pad for coving crazy jagged ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! Great as a second crash pad for coving crazy jagged terrain! LOVE IT! Take it on every trip! The ability to use as a barrel to carry things works well for me and haven't had an issue with it yet!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Conley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the heavy side, but worth it! This conforms to the environment really well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hagerman

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Bulky but Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice pad. Pretty large for the price just a little more bulky than most pads to hike with. On the heavy side. Nice landing though once it's broken in!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite crash pad!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received my crash pad within two days of ordering (SUPER FAST!!) and it looks just as pictured. Material seems durable and it is indeed on the heavier side to carry around. It's stiff at first, but after beating it up with a bat (as instructed), it forms into an incredibly nice cushion to fall onto. Soooo happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nhu-y Thi Phan

customer_reviews.title: Great pad.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and has lots of nice features, like the bottom cover for keeping your gear inside the folded pad. Did really well on uneven surfaces and was great to fall on. Only issue is that it's pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Really well constructed. Ample storage space for gear when carrying the crash pad as a backpack. Nice amount of padding to land on. The ribs do not make it difficult or awkward to land on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to get climbing! This pad is by far the best value I have come across in a while. The shipping was fast and I can't wait to break it in and loosen it up.
customer_reviews.author: jazmin crookes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pad. it works great and is exactly what ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pad. it works great and is exactly what i expected. it was a little lumpy when i got it but loosened up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great pad
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality, thoughtful features. It's a little heavier and bulkier than a normal pad but the benefits are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ehret

customer_reviews.title: love the daisy chains and the baffles
customer_reviews.text: love the daisy chains and the baffles! just a bit to heavy but i'll deal with it for how great it works
customer_reviews.author: Heston Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and excellent protection. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Pineda

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for all sorts of falls and for if you ...
customer_reviews.text: This crash pad is above and beyond the average crash pad. It is perfect for all sorts of falls and for if you have a lot of gear you want to shove in the crash pad. Because the pad is made from recycled foam pellets, it can conform to any type of terrain unlike the crash pads with one or two pieces of foam. It is a little heavy and bulky for a crash pad, but works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Burgard

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure this will also work great as a crash pad
customer_reviews.text: Currently not using it as a crash pad...but as a lounge chair (made it using black pipes and ropes...and this acts as the cushion)! I'm sure this will also work great as a crash pad...but didn't try it. It's pretty comfortable to sit on for an extended period of time!
customer_reviews.author: Yi En Huang

product_meta.title: Mad Rock R3 Crash Pad
product_meta.description: Ankles sure come in handy when you're working an elusive boulder problem, which is why the Mad Rock R3 Crash Pad protects your valuable climbing assets with ferocious dedication and recycled foam. This eco-conscious pad makes an excellent second pad for complicated landings, so you can keep that random rock from ruining your day
feature_bullets: Great for a top layer on top of other traditional crash pads due to its soft landing.
Excels in conforming to uneven surfaces or wrapping around features that you need fall protection from.
The ground shield unfolds to protect the R3's suspension system from dirt and moisture
For every R3 pad purchased, 15lbs of EVA foam is being recycled/reused!
Weight: 17 - 20 lbs due to foam variance, Open Dimensions: 55" x 35" x 4"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
